name: HD 222155
scenarioDescription:
The HD 222155 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 222155 is a star with 1.21 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.85 times its radius. It is located 165.30 light years away from the solar system.

HD 222155 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 222155 system


HD 222155 b

HD 222155 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 5.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 222155 b is 674.1600000000001 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 222155 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 222155, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Haute-Provence Observatory.
